text: Ulrich Aumayer, O.F.M. or Ulrich Aumair (died 1468) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Auxiliary Bishop of Regensburg (1456–1468). (in Latin)"Bishop Ulrich Aumayer (Aumair), O.F.M." Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 29, 2016"Hierapolis in Isauria (Titular See)" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved February 29, 2016"Titular Episcopal See of Hieropolis" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== Ulrich Aumayer was ordained a priest in the Order of Friars Minor. On 3 Jul 1456, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Callixtus III as Auxiliary Bishop of Regensburg and Titular Bishop of Hierapolis in Isauria.. He served as Auxiliary Bishop of Regensburg until his death on 1 Jul 1468.. While bishop, he was the principal co-consecrator of Wilhelm von Reichenau, Bishop of Eichstätt (1464) and Jodok Seitz, Auxiliary Bishop of Augsburg (1464) == See also == *Catholic Church in Germany == References == Category:15th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Callixtus III Category:1468 deaths Category:Franciscan bishops
title: Ulrich Aumayer
